Job Posting:172883 - Position: W26 Student, FCC IT (Winter 2026) 172883B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 09/15/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 09/08/2025 04:37 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Country Fidelity 400 Burrard St Unit 1800, Vancouver V6C 3A6 Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Job Description Student, FCC IT 2026 - Winter W26 Student, FCC IT (Winter 2026) 172883B Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List At Fidelity, we've been helping Canadian investors build better financial futures for over 35 years. We offer individuals and institutions a range of trusted investment portfolios and services - and we're constantly seeking to find new and better ways to help our clients. As a privately owned company, we boldly embrace innovation in all areas as we continue to grow our business into the future. Working with us means you'll be part of a diverse and dedicated group of people who make a real difference for our clients and communities every day. You'll have a wide range of opportunities to grow and develop your career in an inclusive environment where you'll feel valued and supported to be your best - both personally and professionally. What we provide: Fidelity offers you the chance to build a career, develop professionally and explore different career paths throughout the company. Students are placed into an area of interest and will be provided with a mentor to support them throughout their journey. We offer our students an extensive training program to help enhance skills in communication, public speaking, networking, business etiquette and emotional intelligence. Fidelity proudly supports various non-profit organizations and provides students with the opportunity to volunteer to make a difference in their community. You've worked hard to prepare yourself for a great career. No matter what your undergraduate degree is in, there is an opportunity for you at Fidelity. You'll be placed in a division of Fidelity that handles the clearing and custody of client assets, named Fidelity Clearing Canada (FCC). Fidelity Clearing Canada, founded in Toronto in 2009, provides Canadian registered brokerage firms and portfolio managers with trade execution, clearing, custody and back-office support. This part of Fidelity works with our clients (Introducing Brokers and Portfolio Managers) who hold various types of assets. FCC is a fast-growing division of Fidelity, and the future is very bright as we look to be the #1 clearing and custody broker of choice in Canada. How you'll make an impact: As a student in FCC IT, you will have the opportunity to: • Support current business/ technology projects in many aspects, including business systems requirements, information gathering, analysis, and quality assurance and test automation • Work with the business users to gather requirements and assist with providing solutions • Work in an Agile Scrum framework, writing user stories • Identify potential enhancements, bug fixes, or functionality gaps • Review processes and procedures and recommend enhancements for increased efficiencies and productivity Conduct research for new technology initiatives • Job Requirements What we're looking for: • Working towards a university degree with a concentration in Computer Science or related technical program, ideally in your 3rd or 4th year of study. A keen interest and knowledge of Web and Mobile development • • A desire to work on usability and client experience standards • Strong understanding of Internet programming languages Angular and Java. • Knowledge of Application Servers • A creative aptitude focused on User Experience Design • You must be enrolled in a registered co-op program to be considered for this opportunity You must be available on a full-time basis for the duration of the co-op term • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: Careers Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
